metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13619 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 3.0.0 to 3.0.2, 2.6.0 to 2.6.9, and 2.4.0 to 2.4.15, the ASN.1BER dissector and related dissectors could crash. This was addressed inepan/asn1.c by properly restricting buffer increments.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.0.3-1
libwireshark12 - 3.0.3-1
libwiretap9 - 3.0.3-1
libwscodecs2 - 3.0.3-1
libwsutil10 - 3.0.3-1
tshark - 3.0.3-1
wireshark - 3.0.3-1
wireshark-common - 3.0.3-1
wireshark-gtk - 3.0.3-1
wireshark-qt - 3.0.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.3-1').
